author: sucy
title: Cardano Connect
description: Большинство новостей и ресурсов, связанных с Кардано, предоставляются на английском языке, что является препятствием для китайскоговорящих.

f6_assessments.q0: Having an online database, that Chinese users could utilise to help them translate Cardano-specific terms or sentences is a tool that could be very beneficial to the expansion of the community. What I haven't been able to find out, is how technical this dictionary would be and how will the user suggested terms be validated for accuracy. Also, as the database will continue to grow, how will it financially support itself?
f6_assessments.q1:
There is mention of "our team", yet there are no further details provided. How many members does the team have, how many years of experience and proof of it do they have?
While the plan at first sight might look simple, there are many factors to be considered. How long will it take for the initial database to be compiled? How long will the development stage for the front-end last? How will users be able to add terms, will they need to create an account?
There are many details that need to fill out all these questions and many other.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is mention of hiring translators, yet the budget does not cover any expense regarding this matter. How and when will the database be compiled, if there are no funds allocated to the personnel tasked with translation. Will they be volunteering this task?  Is the proposal split into 2 phases, and translation is not covered in this one? 
What is the timeline and the expected launch date? Will there be an MVP or will it be launched as a full fleshed product?
These questions are very important in assessing the progress of the proposal, and having them unanswered leaves the proposal in an inception stage, that would need to be polished before a future resubmission.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies the problem that there are few resources related to Cardano in the Chinese language. The proposer offers as a solution the creation of an online English-Chinese dictionary. This proposal is in line with the challenge as it will help to attract more non English speakers to the Cardano community. The proposer does not present any plans to keep the project sustainable in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not identify who the members of his team are, nor does he present evidence of their abilities. The budget is detailed and appears to be reasonable with the proposed work. The proposal does not have a deadline for completion of the work. The proposer presents a plan showing what will be done but does not set dates for completion of milestones, which would be important to monitor the progress of the proposal. The proposal does not pose greater risks for its implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer clearly presents the target problem and the solution. The proposal presents KPIs that allow you to assess the success of the proposal. It also features a roadmap but lacks dated milestones. I think this would be important for monitoring the progress of the work in a more organized way.

.It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by creating  an online English-Chinese dictionary that translates complicated terms, including Cardano-specific phrases, in seconds  
This proposal shows how it adds value to the Cardano system by creating  an online English-Chinese dictionary that translates complicated terms, including Cardano-specific phrases, in seconds
Key metrics  would be  number of users, number of terms, number of social media mentions and shares, number of CHinese speakers engaging with Cardano.
The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge. Proposal can be scaled up to address future challenges by adding more terms.  This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the awareness and knowledge among Chinese language speakers.  

I can say that this proposal adequately addresses the challenge  hence i have given it a 4 star rating.

If this does not receive funding for whatever reason, one way proposer can improve it is by continuing to build and send press releases to media of your country or social media relating to your subject. Sometimes that one step might motivate someone to view the link and add credibility for your project and give him a better idea on the project which enables him to vote for the project. 

You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading.

f6_assessments.q2: In your proposal, the KPI seem interesting. However, the roadmap ant milestones to develop the project are not clearly define. You should explain what the main milestones of your project are and what are the level of KPI you wanted at this time.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aims to build an online Cardano English-Chinese dictionary. I do not agree the proposal is impactful because the proposal does not address the objectives in the challenge's success (not even one): 
    - Increase adoption and community engagement of non-English speakers. (In my opinion, using a dictionary and trying to translate Cardano resources by themselves is not an easy and convenient way to encourage people come to learn about Cardano, so that it would not address this objective).
    - Increase amount of resources in a variety of languages. (In my opinion, a dictionary with isolated words about Cardano should not be a Cardano resource)
    - A sense of community and conversations. Having people around to talk with. (A Cardano English-Chinese dictionary does not help people gather and talk together absolutely).
I recommend the author should build a platform in which Cardano resources would be translated into Chinese since the team 'includes several bilingual members who can provide translation, interpretation, and localization strategies' as the proposal mentions. That would help Chinese people to understand Cardano resources in an easy way, instead of trying to use the Cardano English-Chinese dictionary and translate by themselves. That would be definitely impactful: not only help to increase adoption and community engagement of Chinese speakers but also help to increase amount of resources in a variety of languages.
f6_assessments.q1: There is a conflict between the plan and the budget of the proposal: Most of the proposal's plan is about to build a database for the dictionary (defining terms and keywords, organizing online discussion for Chinese speakers suggest terms, hiring professional translator). However, budget is about building the platform and marketing cost. There is no cost for the discussion organizing and hiring translator. And there is no plan for building the platform. Therefore, I strongly disagree the proposal is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides KPIs (just KPIs only) for auditability, no roadmap, no milestones and time horizon. Moreover, KPIs does not provide exact numbers as the proposer expects. I recommend the author should fulfill information for the community (and the challenge team) be able to audit the progress and the success of the proposal to make the proposal auditable.
Because of the missing information, I strongly disagree the proposal is auditable

f6_assessments.q0:
Conceptually, this is a useful proposition. It generates an online English-Chinese dictionary that translates complicated terms, including Cardano-specific phrases, in seconds, with the name Cardano Connect.
It will help Chinese users to easily access Cardano-related news and resources
f6_assessments.q1:
The information about the team's experience is very sketchy, it will be easier to evaluate if the proponent provides more information to verify the team's experience: profiles of the people involved (linked in,...), previously successfully implemented projects,...
No roadmap provided. For a project to be evaluated, it is essential to define a short/long term roadmap. It contributes to goal setting, helping to define specific tasks that need to be done within certain time periods.
Asking for a budget of $12,000, people want to know how to spend that money. As for the budget allocation, which is provided too general, further clarification is needed, it is necessary to determine how many people are involved, the number of hours worked, the amount per hour.
There are specific metrics to measure success: for example, in the first 3 months there are 50,000 visits,...
f6_assessments.q2:
The content provided is incomplete, lacking a basis for people to judge its success. The proponent needs to supplement and clarify the following issues: profile of participants / roadmap / success indicators / specific budget allocation,... (as I mentioned in the previous section. ). Besides identifying difficulties-challenges, how to solve those difficulties-challenges is also very necessary.
This is a good idea, if more information is provided, it will increase the trust of the reviewers. Let's work together, don't give up!
